item.title: How long are my Duolingo English Test results valid?
item.description: Your Duolingo English Test results are valid for two years from the date of the test.

item.title: How often can I take the Duolingo English Test?
item.description: According to the information in the official exam guide, you can purchase up to 3 Duolingo English Tests within any 30-day period. This means you can take the test a maximum of three times within a month.

item.title: How long does the Duolingo English Test take?
item.description: According to the provided official exam guide, the Duolingo English Test (DET) consists of the following parts, which take approximately 1 hour to complete.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide to the Duolingo English Test - DET Practice-Ace the Duolingo English Test
item.description: The Duolingo English Test (DET) emerges as a standout option for non-native English speakers, offering a unique blend of convenience, affordability, and reliability. This comprehensive guide delves into every aspect of the DET, providing you with all the information you need to decide if it's the right tool for achieving your language learning goals.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Overall scores
item.description: The Duolingo English Test provides a total score that encapsulates an individual's overall proficiency in the English language.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Production
item.description: The Production component of the Duolingo English Test (DET) assesses a candidate's ability to produce language, which includes both speaking and writing skills.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Conversation
item.description: The Conversation component of the Duolingo English Test (DET) evaluates a candidate's ability to understand and participate in spoken exchanges in English.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Comprehension
item.description: The Comprehension component of the Duolingo English Test (DET) assesses a candidate's ability to understand spoken and written English.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Literacy
item.description: The Literacy component of the Duolingo English Test (DET) evaluates a candidate's proficiency in reading and writing in English.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Compared with CEFR
item.description: The Duolingo English Test (DET) and the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) are both systems for assessing language proficiency.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Compared with TOEFL
item.description: The Duolingo English Test (DET) and the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) are two widely recognized assessments of English language proficiency.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Compared with IELTS
item.description: The Duolingo English Test and the International English Language Testing System (IELTS) are both internationally recognized assessments of English language proficiency.

item.title: Duolingo English Test Rules
item.description: If you break any of the rules of the Duolingo English Test, Duolingo reserves the right to not certify your test results, or to invalidate any previously certified results, without providing a refund.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Interactive Writing
item.description: This question type starts with a prompt that asks candidates to write a response to a given topic or question.

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Write About the Photo
item.description: This question type asks candidates to "write one or more sentences that describe the image."

item.title: Duolingo English Test: Read, Then Speak
item.description: This question type requires candidates to read a given text or question and then provide a spoken response.
